intro: Leucocnide alba, commonly known as the white leucocnide, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its delicate white flowers and hairy foliage, which help it retain moisture in its native habitat. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
